Pre-Game Insights: India and Pakistan are playing in New York for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
India won their first game against Ireland by eight wickets with 46 balls to spare.
Pakistan's poor start in the USA means there's plenty of cricketing context to this game.
Pakistan's team unravelled against Virat Kohli in a high-pressure finish in 2022 and were utterly overwhelmed in 2023.
If Pakistan loses to India again, their chances of qualifying for the Super Eights will be at the mercy of other results going their way.
India are likely to play the same XI that beat Ireland.
Pakistan's Imad Wasim did not play against USA due to a rib-cage injury but is fit and will play against India.
Azam Khan, who made a golden duck in Dallas, could get dropped.
The pitch and conditions are expected to be challenging, with fast bowlers dominating so far.
Weather in New York was sunny on the eve of the match, but some weather websites have forecast showers for Sunday morning.
